words.definition: To do something on time’s basis is how often you do it.
words.example: My grandfather gets his hearing checked on a yearly basis.

words.definition: Biology is the study of living things.
words.example: We learned about the human heart in biology class.

words.definition: A cage is something that holds an animal so it cannot leave.
words.example: We put the parrots in their cage at night.

words.definition: A colleague is somebody you work with.
words.example: My colleague helped me finish the job.

words.definition: A colony is a country controlled by another country.
words.example: The USA used to be a British colony.

words.definition: To debate is to talk about something with people who have different ideas.
words.example: The students debated the new school rules.

words.definition: To depart is to leave some place so you can go to another place.
words.example: The plane departed at 6:00.

words.definition: To depress someone is to make them feel very sad.
words.example: The bad news depressed me.

words.definition: When something is factual, it is true.
words.example: She gave a factual report about the accident.

words.definition: To fascinate someone is to make them very interested.
words.example: The stars fascinate me.

words.definition: A mission is a specific task that someone is sent to do.
words.example: The astronaut’s mission was to go to the moon.

words.definition: Nevertheless means even though something is true.
words.example: He was sick; nevertheless, he went to work.

words.definition: An occupation is a person’s job.
words.example: My father's occupation is a doctor.

words.definition: If you go overseas, you go to a country on the other side of an ocean.
words.example: He goes overseas for business every year.

words.definition: To persuade someone is to make them agree to do something.
words.example: The salesman persuaded me to buy the car.

words.definition: A route is the way you go from one place to another.
words.example: I took the fastest route to the airport.

words.definition: Ruins are the parts of buildings that stay after they have been destroyed.
words.example: We visited the ruins of an old city.

words.definition: A scholar is a person who studies a lot.
words.example: The scholar spent all day in the library.

words.definition: When something is significant, it is important.
words.example: I have a significant problem.

words.definition: A volcano is a mountain that shoots out hot rock and smoke.
words.example: The volcano erupted last night.
